statement.tex: %text Evaluate \[ \int_0^\pi \frac{e^{\cos x}}{e^{\cos x} + e^{-\cos x}}\cdot dx \] %

\\ %text Your friend makes the following assertion \[ \int_0^\pi \frac{e^{\cos x}}{e^{\cos x} + e^{-\cos x}}dx \neq \int_0^\pi \frac{e^{-\cos x}}{e^{-\cos x} + e^{\cos x}}dx\]
\underline\text{Is he/she right? Or is he/she wrong?} %
\\ %text \underline\text{Check our logic} Given the results from Step 1, \underline\text{would the following be true}? %

reason.tex:
%text In fact \[ \int_0^\pi \frac{e^{\cos x}\cdot dx}{e^{\cos x} + e^{-\cos x}}=\int_0^\pi \frac{e^{-\cos x}\cdot dx}{e^{-\cos x} + e^{\cos x}}\]
because there is a \underline\text{nice, little rule} that says \[ \underbrace{\int_0^a f(x)\cdot dx}_{\text{Going from left to right}} = \underbrace{\int_0^a f(a-x)\cdot dx }_{\text{Going from right to left}} \] %
